stories.title: Ethereum's “Ropsten” testnet to be upgraded to Proof-of-Stake in early June

stories.text:
Hi HN:

Just reaching out to the hn community to see if anyone might be able to point me to a paying coding gig, and also provide a small advance in order to obtain a reasonable laptop to perform the work.

I asked for help here last week, and a number of people sent me emergency food money. I have been rationing this money and should be okay for food until my SNAP food benefits renew this coming weekend. I am living unsheltered, and am seeking to reach a point where I can code full time and build a financial base. I live in the countryside where it's warm but there are limited resources here.

I do need basic items like a bicycle, a tent, and a membership at the local coworking space. But, most important perhaps is to obtain a laptop, and a paying project to earn the laptop. Does anyone in the community have a spare laptop (min. 8GB/SSD) or can anyone possibly hire me for coding to pay off a new laptop? I am proficient in most phases of web development and am a seasoned software developer who burned out a few years ago. Seeking to start coding professionally again and establish a low-stress coding routine. I am in my 40's in the USA.

Once I am up and running with needed basics, I can then seek work online, then eventually seek an interview for a ft/permanent position. Just problem solving one problem at a time. If you can help, can you email me at hackernewscontactmail at gmail? Thank you.
stories.title: Ask HN: Work project for laptop and other basics

stories.text:
Sometimes I just don't feel like working. Other times I am in flow at 100% and feel like if I didn't have to sleep or have meetings I could get everything on my plate finished.

How do others feel? Are you mostly working at your optimal productivity / motivation level? Has it changed as you got older?

Maybe it's just me but there are days I get nothing done, and when you have daily stand-ups you simply cannot say that so you just make shit up or say you were swamped in busy work.

I'm wondering if there is a better philosophy to managing people with this in mind, although I am finding that humans need deadlines and external pressure in some form or nothing gets done.
stories.title: Ask HN: How often are you operating at 100% productivity/motivation?
